name: Magion
description: '''Magion''' was a [[Dutch people|Dutch]] [[symphonic metal]]band from [[The Hague]], existing from 2005 to 2014. The band released two albums, an EP and two demos, and performed with bands such as [[Epica (band)|Epica]], [[Delain]], [[Trail of Tears (band)|Trail of Tears]] & [[Jorn (band)|Jorn]]. The album "''Close to Eternity''" was mastered by the [[Swedes|Swedish]] rock/metal producer and musician [[Dan Swan√∂]]. Through the years the popularity of the group gradually grew, peaking late 2013 after the release of their second album "''A Different Shade of Darkness''", which generated various media attention  and resulted in a performance at the 11th edition of the annual [[Metal Female Voices Fest]] in Belgium, late 2013. The band split up after disagreements in the spring of 2014.
